movies.title: The Moleman of Belmont Avenue
movies.plot: The Mugg Brothers inherit an apartment building with a monster living in the basement that's eating everything in sight.
movies.simplePlot: The Mugg Brothers inherit an apartment building with a monster living in the basement that's eating everything in sight.

biography.bio: Justin DiGiacomo is an actor, known for The Moleman of Belmont Avenue (2013).
biography.name: Justin DiGiacomo

biography.bio: Mike Bradecich is an actor and director, known for Fargo (2014), The Moleman of Belmont Avenue (2013) and Mighty Med (2013).
biography.name: Mike Bradecich

biography.bio: John LaFlamboy is a producer and actor, known for The Moleman of Belmont Avenue (2013), Squeal (2008) and Starving Artist Beatdown (2014).
biography.name: John LaFlamboy

biography.bio: Nicholas Barron is known for his work on The Moleman of Belmont Avenue (2013).
biography.name: Nicholas Barron

biography.bio: Cat Bernier is known for her work on Sinners and Saints (2010), We Are Still Here (2015) and Daylight's End (2016).
biography.name: Cat Bernier

biography.bio: Brian Boland is an actor, known for Paranormal Activity 2 (2010), Paranormal Activity 3 (2011) and Death of a President (2006).
biography.name: Brian Boland

biography.bio: Paul Clayton is an actor, known for The Moleman of Belmont Avenue (2013).
biography.name: Paul Clayton

biography.bio: Dana DeLorenzo was born on January 1, 1983 in Youngstown, Ohio, USA as Dana Rose DeLorenzo. She is an actress, known for Ash vs Evil Dead (2015), A Very Harold & Kumar 3D Christmas (2011) and The Mad Ones (2016).
biography.name: Dana DeLorenzo

biography.bio: Veteran character actor Robert Englund was born in Glendale, California, to Janis (MacDonald) and John Kent Englund, an aeronautics engineer. He has Swedish, Danish, Scottish, and English ancestry. Since 1973, Englund has appeared in over 75 feature films and starred in four TV series. He has starred alongside Oscar-winners Henry Fonda, Susan Sarandon and Jeff Bridges. Since 1984 he's achieved international fame as the iconic boogeyman Freddy Krueger in the hit franchise A Nightmare on Elm Street and its seven sequels. Englund has guest starred in hundreds of hours of TV most recently Bones, Criminal Minds and Hawaii 5-0. He will soon be seen starring in the horror film Fear Clinic, and the English thriller The Last Showing, he can be heard as the voice of the Evil Beaver in Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles cartoon show.
biography.name: Robert Englund

biography.bio: Dina Facklis is an actress and producer, known for The Weather Man (2005), Punching (2013) and The Moleman of Belmont Avenue (2013).
biography.name: Dina Facklis

biography.bio: Noah Gregoropoulos is an actor and writer, known for Insanity (2005), Mortal Kombat: Armageddon (2006) and The Moleman of Belmont Avenue (2013).
biography.name: Noah Gregoropoulos

biography.bio: Greg Hollimon was born on May 2, 1956 in Chicago, Illinois, USA. He is an actor, known for The Fugitive (1993), Strangers with Candy (1999) and Strangers with Candy (2005).
biography.name: Greg Hollimon

biography.bio: T.J. Jagodowski was born on September 2, 1971 in Holyoke, Massachusetts, USA. He is an actor and writer, known for Stranger Than Fiction (2006), Oz the Great and Powerful (2013) and The Ice Harvest (2005).
biography.name: T.J. Jagodowski

biography.bio: Dan Jessup is an actor, known for The Moleman of Belmont Avenue (2013), The Miss (2009) and Thanks Mom (2011).
biography.name: Dan Jessup

biography.bio: Tim Kazurinsky is an American actor and screenwriter known for his tenure as a writer and cast member on Saturday Night Live (1981-1984) and for playing Officer Carl Sweetchuck in the "Police Academy" film franchise. Notable screenwriting credits include "About Last Night..." (1986) and "For Keeps?" (1988). Kazurinsky's screenplay for the film "Strange Relations" (2001) earned him nominations for a BAFTA Award and WGA Award. Additional film and television appearances include "Shakes The Clown", "Neighbors", "Somewhere In Time", "Curb Your Enthusiasm", "According To Jim" and "Chicago Justice." A mainstay of the Chicago theatre scene, Kazurinsky was a member of The Second City. He has twice been nominated for Chicago's prestigious Joseph Jefferson Award for his stage work. Kazurinsky toured the United States as the Wonderful Wizard of Oz in the hit musical "Wicked" and later appeared on Broadway in the critically-acclaimed comedy, "An Act Of God" (opposite Jim Parsons). Kazurinsky resides in Chicago with his family.
biography.name: Tim Kazurinsky
